title: Introduction to the General Functions of LCZ4r
text: LCZ4r package fundamental functions, serving unique purpose: Happy coding, enjoy exploring LCZ4r package!

what: Obtain an visualize the LCZ map
title: Introduction to the General Functions of LCZ4r
text: lcz_get_map() function allows obtain LCZ map city specific Region Interest (ROI) using global LCZ map developed Demuzere et al. (2022). rare cases function encounters inconsistencies, can rely lcz_get_map2() alternative.
code: library(LCZ4r) # Get the LCZ map for your city, e.g., "Rio de Janeiro" lcz_map <- lcz_get_map(city="Rio de Janeiro") #> Congratulations! You've successfully got Rio de Janeiro LCZ map.  # Visualize the obtained LCZ map lcz_plot_map(lcz_map, isubtitle = "Rio de Janeiro") #> Congratulations! You've successfully generated the LCZ map.

title: Introduction to the General Functions of LCZ4r
text: lcz_cal_area() function designed calculate Local Climate Zone (LCZ) areas. can use like :
code: #E.g., "Rio de Janeiro" LCZarea <- lcz_cal_area(lcz_map, iplot = TRUE) #> That's cool! You've successfully calculated the LCZ area classes. LCZarea

title: Introduction to the General Functions of LCZ4r
text: lcz_get_parameters() function allows retrieve various LCZ parameters, including minimum, maximum, mean values, sourced Stewart Oke (2012). parameters can converted either shapefiles raster stacks. ’s glimpse available LCZ parameters:
code: # Extract the LCZ parameters LCZpar <- lcz_get_parameters(lcz_map, istack = TRUE) #> You've successfully generated a raster stack of all LCZ parameters.  # Visualize the selected parameter, for instance, Maximum Sky View Factor lcz_plot_parameters(LCZpar, iselect = "SVF3", isubtitle = "Rio de Janeiro") #> You've generated SVF3 LCZ parameter map.

what: Tools for Local Climate Zones and Urban Heat Island Analysis
title: Tools for Local Climate Zones and Urban Heat Island Analysis
text: part Zoom City Carbon Model (ZCCM), present LCZ4r, set R functions models Urban Heat Island high-definition using Local Climate Zone classification local air temperature readings. Please note LCZ4r package R currently undergoing develop, caution advised interpreting outcomes. methodology based Anjos M., Madeiros D, Meier F, Castelhano F. LCZ4r, R package Urban Local Climate Zones Heat Islands Analysis (preparation). Happy coding!

title: Tools for Local Climate Zones and Urban Heat Island Analysis
text: install LCZ4r use development version GitHub latest features: ```{r, include=TRUE} install.packages(“devtools”) #necessary library(devtools) # necessary devtools::install_github(“ByMaxAnjos/LCZ4r”) library(LCZ4r) ```

title: Tools for Local Climate Zones and Urban Heat Island Analysis
text: LCZ4r package comprehensive toolset, featuring total 13 functions. functions categorized two main types: general functions local functions. general functions tailored circumstances specific LCZ data readily available. contrast, local functions designed operate extensive data inputs, urban meteorological network readings, including air temperature. lcz_get_map() - Obtain LCZ map lcz_get_map2() - Obtain LCZ map (downloaded global LCZ map) lcz_plot_map() - Visualize LCZ map lcz_cal_area() - Calculate LCZ areas lcz_get_parameters() - Retrieve LCZ parameters lcz_plot_parameters() - Visualize LCZ parameters lcz_ts() - Analyze LCZ Time Series lcz_anamoly() - Explore LCZ Thermal Anomalies lcz_interp_krige() - Perform LCZ Interpolation Kriging lcz_eval_krige() - Evaluate LCZ Interpolation Kriging lcz_interp_idw() - Perform LCZ Interpolation IDW lcz_eval_idw() - Evaluate LCZ Interpolation IDW lcz_uhi() - Assess LCZ Urban Heat Island Intensity

title: Tools for Local Climate Zones and Urban Heat Island Analysis

title: Calculate LCZ areas — lcz_cal_area
text: function calculates areas LCZ classes percentage square kilometers.

title: Calculate LCZ areas — lcz_cal_area
code: lcz_cal_area(x, iplot = TRUE, isave = FALSE)

title: Calculate LCZ areas — lcz_cal_area
text: x raster SpatRaster layer containing LCZ classes. iplot Logical, indicating whether create plot (default TRUE). isave Save plot directory.

title: Calculate LCZ areas — lcz_cal_area
text: summary table LCZ class areas iplot FALSE, otherwise, bar plot.

title: Calculate LCZ areas — lcz_cal_area
code: #Calcute the LCZ area #my_lcz_area <- lcz_cal_area(x= my_lcz_map, iplot = TRUE, isave = TRUE)

what: Obtain the LCZ map for a Specified Area — lcz_get_map
title: Obtain the LCZ map for a Specified Area — lcz_get_map
text: function retrieves Local Climate Zone (LCZ) global mapping dataset created Demuzere et al. (2022) available https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-14-3835-2022. allows obtain LCZ map specific area interest, can city, state, region, custom-defined shape.

title: Obtain the LCZ map for a Specified Area — lcz_get_map
code: lcz_get_map(city = NULL, roi = NULL, isave_map = FALSE, isave_global = FALSE)

title: Obtain the LCZ map for a Specified Area — lcz_get_map
text: city character string specifying name target area based OpenStreetMap project. roi Optionally, can provide Region Interest (ROI) ESRI shapefile format clip LCZ map custom area. isave_map Logical. Set TRUE wish save resulting clipped map raster TIFF file local machine. isave_global Logical. Set TRUE wish save global LCZ map raster TIFF file local machine.

title: Obtain the LCZ map for a Specified Area — lcz_get_map
text: Terra raster TIFF file containing LCZ classes specified area interest.

title: Obtain the LCZ map for a Specified Area — lcz_get_map
code: # Example 1: Load the LCZ map for a city # my_lcz_city <- lcz_get_map(city = "ExampleCity")  # Example 2: Get LCZ map for a custom region of interest # custom_roi <- sf::st_read("custom_roi.shp") # roi_lcz <- lcz_get_map(roi = custom_roi, isave_map = TRUE)  # Example 3: Retrieve the LCZ map for a country (no custom ROI specified) # my_lcz_country <- lcz_get_map(city = "Brazil", roi = NULL, isave_map = TRUE)

what: Obtain the LCZ map for a Specified Area (with downloaded global LCZ map) — lcz_get_map2
title: Obtain the LCZ map for a Specified Area (with downloaded global LCZ map) — lcz_get_map2
text: function retrieves Local Climate Zone (LCZ) global mapping dataset created Demuzere et al. (2022) available https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-14-3835-2022. allows obtain LCZ map specific area interest, can city, state, region, custom-defined shape.

title: Obtain the LCZ map for a Specified Area (with downloaded global LCZ map) — lcz_get_map2
code: lcz_get_map2(x, city = NULL, roi = NULL, isave_map = FALSE)

title: Obtain the LCZ map for a Specified Area (with downloaded global LCZ map) — lcz_get_map2
text: x SpatRaster object containing LCZ map. can download using link: https://zenodo.org/records/8419340/files/lcz_filter_v3.tif?download=1". , suggested use terra::rast(path/lcz_filter_v3.tif") import raster .tif R. city character string specifying name target area based OpenStreetMap project. roi Optionally, can provide Region Interest (ROI) ESRI shapefile format clip LCZ map custom area. isave_map Logical. Set TRUE wish save resulting clipped map raster TIFF file local machine.

title: Obtain the LCZ map for a Specified Area (with downloaded global LCZ map) — lcz_get_map2
text: Terra raster TIFF file containing LCZ classes specified area interest.

title: Obtain the LCZ map for a Specified Area (with downloaded global LCZ map) — lcz_get_map2
code: # Load the LCZ map from you pc # my_map <- terra::rast(path/lcz_filter_v3.tif")  # Example 2: Get LCZ map for a custom region of interest # custom_roi <- sf::st_read("custom_roi.shp") # roi_lcz <- lcz_get_map2(my_map, roi = custom_roi)  # Example 3: Retrieve the LCZ map for a country (no custom ROI specified) # my_lcz_country <- lcz_get_map2(my_map, city = "Brazil")

title: Retrieve LCZ parameters — lcz_get_parameters
text: function extracts 34 Local Climate Zone (LCZ) parameters based classification scheme developed Stewart Oke (2012). LCZs provide valuable information urban morphology useful urban climate environmental studies.

title: Retrieve LCZ parameters — lcz_get_parameters
code: lcz_get_parameters(x, iselect = "", istack = TRUE, ishp = FALSE, isave = FALSE)

title: Retrieve LCZ parameters — lcz_get_parameters
text: x LCZ map .tiff format SpatRaster object containing LCZ classes. iselect Character vector. Specify one parameter names retrieve specific parameters. example, "SVF1" get minimum Sky View Factor, c("SVF1", "z0") select multiple parameters. istack Logical. TRUE, returns parameters raster stack. FALSE, returns list individual parameter rasters. ishp Logical. TRUE, returns parameters ESRI shapefile. isave Set TRUE want save clipped resulting map raster.tiff .shp file local machine.

title: Retrieve LCZ parameters — lcz_get_parameters
text: 'istack' TRUE, returns raster stack containing 34 LCZ-related parameters.         'istack' FALSE, returns list individual parameter rasters.         'ishp' TRUE, returns ESRI shapefile containing parameters.         'iselect' specified, returns selected parameter(s) raster(s).

title: Retrieve LCZ parameters — lcz_get_parameters
code: # Load the LCZ map #lcz_map <- raster::raster("path/to/lcz_map.tif")  # Get LCZ parameters as a raster stack #lcz_params_stack <- lcz_get_parameters(lcz_map, istack = TRUE)  # Get LCZ parameters as a list of individual parameter rasters #lcz_params_list <- lcz_get_parameters(lcz_map, istack = FALSE)  # Access individual parameters from the list #specific_param <- lcz_params_list$parameter_name  # Get specific parameters as a raster or shapefile #selected_params <- lcz_get_parameters(lcz_map, iselect = c("SVF1", "VEG1"))

what: Plot Local Climate Zone (LCZ) Map — lcz_plot_map
title: Plot Local Climate Zone (LCZ) Map — lcz_plot_map
text: function generates graphical representation LCZ (Local Climate Zone) map provided SpatRaster object.

title: Plot Local Climate Zone (LCZ) Map — lcz_plot_map
code: lcz_plot_map(x, isubtitle = "", isave = FALSE, legend = "name")

title: Plot Local Climate Zone (LCZ) Map — lcz_plot_map
text: x SpatRaster object containing LCZ map plotted. isubtitle optional subtitle plot, allowing specify area region represented map. isave Logical. Set TRUE want save plot working directory. legend Specify type legend include plot. Use "code" display LCZ codes legend.

title: Plot Local Climate Zone (LCZ) Map — lcz_plot_map
text: visual representation LCZ map ggplot format

title: Plot Local Climate Zone (LCZ) Map — lcz_plot_map
code: # Example: Plot an LCZ map with the legend showing LCZ codes and specify a subtitle. # myplot <- lcz_plot_map(x = myLCZmap, isubtitle = "My Area", legend = "code")

title: Visualize LCZ parameters — lcz_plot_parameters
text: function plots parameters Local Climate Zone map.

title: Visualize LCZ parameters — lcz_plot_parameters
code: lcz_plot_parameters(   x,   iselect = "",   isubtitle = "",   all = FALSE,   isave = FALSE )

title: Visualize LCZ parameters — lcz_plot_parameters
text: x LCZ map SpatRaster stack format. iselect Character vector. Specify one parameter names retrieve specific parameters. example, "SVF1" get minimum Sky View Factor, c("z0", "VEG3") select multiple parameters. isubtitle Character, specifying subtitle plot. Logical, specifying whether save selected parameters LCZ4r_output. Default FALSE. isave Logical, indicating whether save plot directory. Default FALSE.

title: Visualize LCZ parameters — lcz_plot_parameters
text: plot selected LCZ parameters.

title: Visualize LCZ parameters — lcz_plot_parameters
code: # Plot the minimum Sky View Factor (SVF1) for your city # lcz_plot_parameters(x = lcz_map, iselect = "SVF1", isubtitle = "Rio de Janeiro")  # Plot multiple parameters and save them to the LCZ4r_output directory # lcz_plot_parameters(x = lcz_map, iselect = c("SVF1", "HEI1"))

title: Analyze LCZ Time Series — lcz_ts
text: function generates graphical representation time series air temperature data different Local Climate Zones (LCZs)

title: Analyze LCZ Time Series — lcz_ts
code: lcz_ts(   x,   data_frame = "",   var = "",   station_id = "",   ...,   time.freq = "hour",   by = NULL,   hemisphere = "northern",   impute = NULL,   iplot = FALSE,   ylab = "Air temperature [Degree Celsius]" )

title: Analyze LCZ Time Series — lcz_ts
text: x SpatRaster object containing LCZ map. LCZ map can obtained using lcz_get_map() function. data_frame data frame containing air temperature measurements station IDs. data frame date field hourly higher resolution format. var Name variable, e.g. air temperature, dataframe. station_id Name station ID variable dataframe. ... Utilities selectBydata openair package. start date string form e.g. “1/2/1999” format .e. “YYYY-mm-dd”, “1999-02-01”. year years select e.g. year = 1998:2004 select 1998-2004 inclusive year = c(1998, 2004) select 1998 2004. month months select. Can either numeric e.g. month = 1:6 select months 1-6 (January June), name e.g. month = c(“January”, “December”). time.freq Defines time period average . Default “hour”. Temporal components data (e.g.,“sec”, “min”, “hour”, “day”, “DSTday”, “week”, “month”, “quarter” “year”). See argument type openair package. hemisphere Hemisphere splitting data seasons (“northern” “southern”). impute Method impute missing values (“mean”, “median”, “knn”, “bag”). iplot Set TRUE want save plot working directory. ylab y-axis name. Default “Air temperature”.

title: Analyze LCZ Time Series — lcz_ts
text: visual representation time series air temperature LCZ ggplot format

title: Analyze LCZ Time Series — lcz_ts
code: # Hourly air temperature values in 2019. # my_ts <- lcz_ts(my_map, df = air_UCON, var = "airT", station_id = "station", year = 2019)

code: lhs %>% rhs

text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.
